revised_title: The Dual Origin of Mammalian Teeth: A Reassessment of Ornithorhynchus Teeth and Their Affinities
tldr: The author examines the dental structures of Ornithorhynchus and questions the widely accepted theory that all mammals descended from reptilian ancestors. The author argues that the Ornithorhynchus teeth may have arisen independently in a relatively recent ancestor, challenging the notion that Monotremes retain many Sauropsida-like features due to degradation and reversion.
